Description.Name: River Hawk
Description.Details: The River Hawk is arguably the greatest failure ever produced by the RAD Group, being originally built for the Star League in 2739 shortly after the Osprey was created, with many referring to it as a '100 ton Charger' thanks to the standard RH-A-SL's massive RADTech 400 standard fusion engine, which in combination with it's underwhelming weapons setup and a pathetic 10.5 tons of standard armor quickly led to the mech suffering the same fate as the Charger it is often likened to during the Star League era, and also like the Charger, would be saved as a desperate and shattered RAD Group found the production line for the chassis was one of the few left functioning and would manage to sell these machines to the Great Houses during the Succession Wars despite it's flaws, meaning the chassis can be found semi-frequently throughout the Inner Sphere. The RH-A-FWL was originally a Free Worlds League refit of the mech that would go on to be one of the more popular refit kits for the River Hawk, completely stripping out the weapons for a Large Laser with 7 Medium Lasers for decent ammo free firepower, though even with 5 additional heat sinks, this setup is rather taxing on the cooling system. It also gets 3 tons of additional armor as well, letting it fair somewhat better than many of it's kin.
